Running the test suite is optional. Failure of test-patchbomb is expected with Python-2.7.x (x > 7). To test the results in the subdiretory tests/tmp, skipping the failing test, issue:

screen.userinput: cat > tests/blacklists/test-failed << "EOF" # Failure with Python-2.7.8 test-patchbomb.t EOF rm -rf tests/tmp && TESTFLAGS="--tmpdir tmp --blacklist blacklists/test-failed" \ make check

sect2.para: More failing tests might be added to that file, if necessary. Tests may be run in parallel, just add -j$(getconf _NPROCESSORS_ONLN) to TESTFLAGS. In order to investigate a particular apparently failing test, e.g test-parse-date.t, issue the following commands (notice that omitting --debug sometimes modifies the result):

screen.userinput: pushd tests && rm -rf tmp && ./run-tests.py --debug --tmpdir tmp test-parse-date.t && popd
